item.name: ExecutionRecord

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description: Execution records correspond to the Executions search on the Process Reporting page in the Boomi Integration user interface. The Execution Record object contains information about a process execution, including the execution date, status, process information, Atom information, and error messages along with other fields.

item.name: DeployedPackage

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

body.raw:
<QueryConfig xmlns="http://api.platform.boomi.com/">
  <QueryFilter>
   <expression operator="and" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="GroupingExpression">
		<nestedExpression operator="EQUALS" property="environmentId"
		  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="SimpleExpression">
		  <argument>{{envID_Dev}}</argument>
		</nestedExpression>
		<nestedExpression operator="EQUALS" property="packageId"
		  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="SimpleExpression">
		  <argument>{{packageComponentId}}</argument>
		</nestedExpression>
		<nestedExpression operator="EQUALS" property="active"
		  xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="SimpleExpression">
		  <argument>true</argument>
		</nestedExpression>
	</expression>
  </QueryFilter>
</QueryConfig>

item.description:
The Deployed Package object represents a packaged component that is deployed to an environment.

You must have the Packaged Component Deployment privilege (formerly known as the Process Deployment privilege) to use the Deployed Package object. If you want to use the CREATE operation to create a packaged component and deploy it in a single operation, you must also have the Packaged Component Management privilege (formerly known as the Package Management privilege).

item.name: PackageComponent

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Packaged Component object represents a component that is packaged for deployment to an environment. You can use the Packaged Component object to create new packaged components, query for packaged components, or restore deleted packaged components.

In addition to processes, the following types of components can be converted into packaged components and deployed to an environment independently:

API Proxy

API Service

Certificate (public X.509)

Custom Library

Flow Service

Process Route

Processing Group

Note: You must have the Packaged Component Management privilege to use the Packaged Component object.

item.name: Account

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Account object provides information about an AtomSphere account, including the users associated with the account, connector licensing information, and general information.

Note: The ability to create and delete accounts is available only through the AtomSphere Partner API.

item.name: Event

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
Event records correspond to the notifications that are available in the Boomi AtomSphere platform RSS feeds and sent in email notifications. The Event object returns information about the different types of events, including process execution events, user notifications, and Atom monitoring events.

Note: Event records are purged after seven days.

item.description: Execution records correspond to the Executions search on the Process Reporting page in the Boomi Integration user interface. The Execution Record object contains information about a process execution, including the execution date, status, process information, Atom information, and error messages along with other fields.

item.name: AuditLog

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description: The Audit Log object represents an entry in the audit log. Audit log entries are retained indefinitely — there is no purge schedule.

item.name: Deployments

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Deployment object represents a component deployment.

CAUTION:
The Deployment object is a deprecated API and should no longer be used. It is highly recommended that you take advantage of the API functionality provided by the Packaged Component and Deployed Package objects instead. This change is to support the introduction of Packaged Component Deployments, which leverages the way Legacy account users deploy components to environments. For more information about Boomi's API object deprecation status, see the topic API deprecation and versioning policy.

Administrators of Legacy deployment accounts are highly encouraged to take advantage of the new Packaged Components Deployment by upgrading their accounts. Learn more about the new deployment workflow and how to upgrade Legacy accounts to use the new deployment workflow. In the meantime, do not use the replacement API without first converting your Legacy account.

Processes that contain Process Route components cannot be deployed as a unit via the API. The parent process, the Process Route component, and any subprocesses that the process route calls must be deployed independently.

item.name: ProcessSchedules

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Process Schedules object represents the execution schedules for a deployed process.

A Process Schedules object is created for every deployed process by default. Initially, the object is empty and no execution schedule is in effect.

item.name: Process

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Process object represents a process that is available to the requesting account.

This object is primarily used to assist with integration packs and extensions for multi-install integration packs.

To retrieve general information about a process or other type of component, use the Component Metadata object instead.

item.name: Atom

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Atom object represents an Atom, Molecule, or Atom Cloud.

Note: Many of the fields in the Atom object correspond to controls in the Atom Information panel of the Atom Management page.

item.name: EnvironmentExtensions

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Environment Extensions object represents the extension (process override) values for an environment.

The Environment Extensions object supports the ability to retrieve and update environment extension values. The functionality provided in the Environment Extensions object mimics the actions you can perform from the Atom Management > Environment Management > Environment Extensions dialog in Boomi Integration.

item.name: Environment

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Environment object represents an environment.

For accounts with Unlimited environment support, environments can be classified as either Production or Test. For accounts with Basic environment support, all environments are classified as production environments.

Note: The fields in the Environment object correspond to controls in the Environment Properties panel of the Atom Management page.

item.name: ComponentMetadata

exec: // Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present
// Generate the basic authentication header if its not already present

item.description:
The Component object represents a component in the Boomi Integration service. You can use the Metadata API object to retrieve metadata information for a given component, such as name, component type, folder location, and more.

You can also use the Component Metadata object's GET and QUERY operations to find:

All components that were created within a specific date range

All components that were modified by a specific user

All components of a certain type

The revision history for a specified component

For example, you can use a combination of these operations to retrieve the revision history for a given component, or to create audit reports of which users changed a component.

Note: The ComponentMetadata API is accessible only with Build Read Access or Build Read and Write Access privileges.

Custom Library

Flow Service

Process Route

Processing Group

Note: You must have the Packaged Component Management privilege to use the Packaged Component object.
